cyclone.name: ETA
cyclone.current_location: about 90 mi (145 km) W of Camagüey, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn north-northwest, cross the Florida Keys tonight, then meander westward over the southeast Gulf of Mexico toward the central Gulf Coast late week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or over the Florida Keys

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and Storm-Surge Watches extend from Deerfield Beach to Bonita Beach FL and the Florida Keys.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warnings in effect for much of south-central Cuba, the Northwestern Bahamas, South Florida coast, the Florida Keys, and Florida Bay.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South-central Cuba, the Florida Keys and South Florida Atlantic and Gulf coasts; later portions of Florida’s west coast and the eastern Gulf of Mexico shoreline.
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤8%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds late Wednesday–Thursday; otherwise breezy northeasterlies.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation of 1–2 ft possible along the Georgia coast if onshore flow develops mid-week.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands may bring 1–2 inches of rain to coastal Georgia; heavy-rain core remains over Florida.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough surf and dangerous rip currents likely along the Georgia and South Carolina beaches mid-week.
